chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Basil John Raffa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to Clerk of Court Office with payment plan to be restarted as of January 1, 2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.
$200.00 DNA Surcharge to be paid to Clerk of Court Office with restarted payment plan on January 1, 2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
